    Quiver

    quiver([X, Y], U, V, [C], **kw)

    ì œê°€ ë²¡í„°ë¥¼

    Parameters

    • X , Y : 1D or 2D array-like .optional

    • U , V : 1D or 2D array-like
      • arrow direction
      • X,Y ì˜ ìˆ˜ì™€ ê°™ì€ ìˆ˜ ê°€ ìžˆì–´ì•¼ í•©ë‹ˆë‹¤.
    • C : 1D or 2D array-like, optional
      • colorë¥¼ ì§€ì • í•´ì¤ë‹ˆë‹¤. ex, [0,0,1,1]
    • units : {â€˜widthâ€™, â€˜heightâ€™, â€˜dotsâ€™, â€˜inchesâ€™, â€˜xâ€™, â€˜yâ€™, â€˜xyâ€™}, default: â€˜widthâ€™

    • scale : float, optional
      • arrowì˜ ë‹¨ìœ„ê¸¸ì´ ì„¤ì • e. g : m/s -> sê°€ scaleì¸ê±° ê°™ìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤.

    Example

    import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

x_pos=[0.1]*4
y_pos=[0.1]*4
x_dir=[1,0,3,2]
y_dir=[0,1,1,10]

fix,ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10,10) )

ax.quiver(x_pos,y_pos,x_dir,y_dir, [0,0,1,1],units='xy',headwidth=2,scale=12,width = 0.005)

ax.axis([0,1,0,1])

plt.axis('off')
plt.show()
